intro: Haplopappus tenuilobus, commonly known as the slender-lobed pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bracts. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open plains. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, contributing to its ecological role in pollination and seed dispersal.
